div.head: HERESIES 4
OPEN MEETING
div.p: The Editorial Group of Heresies 4 will hold an open meeting on Wednesday, April 26, 8 P.M., at the women’s Coffee House, 54 7th Avenue South, New York City.

HERESIES is an idea-oriented journal devoted to the examination of art and polities from aennnist perspective. We believe that what is commonly called art can have aBolitical derpact, and that in the making of art and of all cultural artifices our identities as women play a distinct role. We hope thateziÈs will.stim éloque arouud radical political. and aesthetie theory, ancourage the writing of the taistory of femina sapiens, and generate new creative daergies among women. It will be a place where diversity can be articulated. We are committed to the broadening of the definition and function of art.

HERESIES is structure as a collective of feminists, some of whom are also socialiste, marxists, les deinists or anarchists; our fields include lainting, sculpture, writing,ifropology, literature, performance, art history, arbitecture and filmmaking. Wille the themselves of the individual issues will be determined by the collective, each issue will have a different editorial staff made up of women who want to work on that issue as well as members of the collective. Proposals for issues may be conceived and presented to theHERESIES Collective by groups of women not associated with the collective. Each issue will take a different usual form, chosen by the group responsible. HERESIES will try to be accountable to and in touch with the international 18ministselmunity. An open evolution meeting will be held after the appurance of each issue. Topics for issues will be advanced well in advance in order to collect material from many sources. Possibly satellite pamphlets and broadsides will be produced containing the discussion of each central theme. In additionHERESIES provideing for people who work editorially, in design and in production, both on-the-job and through workshops. As part of its commitment to the public HERESIES houses andebaintains the women Artists’ Slide Registry

As women, we are aware that historically the connections between our lives, our arts and our ideas have been supposed. One these connoctions are clarified they can function as a means to dissolve the alienation between artist and audience, and to understand the relationship between art and polities, work and workers. As a step toward a demystification of art, we reject the standard relationship of Iricism to art within the present system, which has often become the relationship of advertiser to product. We will not Cdvertise a new set of genus-products just because they are made by women. We are not committed to any particular style of aesthetic, nor to the competitive mentality that per vades the art world. Our view of feminism is one of process and change, and we feel that in the process of this dialecte we can foster a change in the meaning of art
